name: Discovery South of Viet Nam 4 days
summary: Start and end in Ho Chi Minh City! With the adventure tour Discovery South of Viet Nam 4 days, you have a 4 day tour package taking you through Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam and 3 other destinations in Vietnam. Discovery South of Viet Nam 4 days includes accommodation in a hotel as well as an expert guide, meals, transport and more.

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrive Ho Chi Minh (No meal)
timeline.description:
Arrival Ho Chi Minh city
Welcome to Saigon! You will be met at the airport and transferred to hotel in Sai Gon. After checking into the hotel, the rest of the day is yours to enjoy. Sai Gon is a bustling, dynamic and industrious centre, the largest city in the country, the economic capital and the cultural trendsetter. Yet within the teeming metropolis are the timeless traditions and beauty of an ancient culture.
Free and easy
Overnight in Ho Chi Minh.

timeline.title: Day 2: My Tho- Ben Tre the Upper Mekong River (meals incl: B/ L)
timeline.description:
A smooth one-and-half-hour bus ride through rice field scenery along National Highway 1 brings you to the beautiful rural district of Trung Luong.
On arrival at My Tho, after visiting Vinh Trang pagoda, take a motor boat to enter My Tho city through Bao Dinh natural canal. Take a leisurely cruise on the Tien River to view the four beautiful islands known as Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise islands.
Enjoy lunch at the local restaurant, then visit the coconut candy mill and take an amazing rowing boat trip along the small canal on a hand-rowed sampan under the shadow of the water coconut trees along natural canals. Then enjoy seasonal fruit & honey tea to the sound of "Southern Vietnamese folk music", performed by locals.
Meet at the bus and return to Ho Chi Minh City. 
Overnight in Ho Chi Minh.

timeline.title: Day 3: Cu Chi tunnels- Ho Chi Minh city (meals incl: B/ L)
timeline.description:
In the morning, visit Cu Chi tunnels
8.00am Located 60km from Ho Chi Minh City, Cu Chi is now considered a heroic district for its role during the American war in Vietnam. It is legendary for its network of tunnels, which extends over 220km, and is a popular destination for both Vietnamese and foreign visitors. Today, Cu Chi is a tranquil place of rice paddy fields with ducks and water buffalos bathing in the rivers alongside the road. But this peaceful rural scene belies the terrible destruction and defoliation caused by bombing and mines when Cu Chi was a "Free Target Zone". Cu Chi still contains plenty of evidence of the fierce battle that took place here and all over this area you will find the remnants of war.

In the afternoon, we will visit the War Remnants Museum, the Reunification Palace, which was the residence of the President of South Vietnam until the end of the war in April 1975, and some beautiful French colonial structures including the Notre Dame Catheral, Opera House and the Old Central Post Office.
17:00 come back hotel.
Overnight in Ho Chi Minh.

timeline.title: Day 4: Ho Chi Minh departure(meals incl: B)
timeline.description:
Have a breakfast at your hotel.
Free time and easy until departure time, the driver takes you to the airport for your flight.
End of services!

timeline.title: Full day Sightseeing in Ho Chi Minh City & Cu Chi Tunnels. (B, L)
timeline.description:
This morning enjoy a city tour that includes the Reunification Hall, formerly known as the Presidential Palace. It was towards this modern building that Communist tanks rolled on the morning of April 30, 1975, as Saigon fell. This fascinating building is filled with history still fresh in the minds of many. The tour also includes the Old Post Office, the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Jade Emperor Pagoda, Chinatown and Binh Tay Market – the central market for the city and one of the liveliest areas. Next we visit the Cu Chi Tunnels, the incredible network of tunnels that once stretched for 210 miles. This underground complex was built by guerilla fighters beginning in 1940 and construction continued throughout the Vietnam War. We return to our hotel where the evening is free. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.
Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similar

Today takes you to My Tho, the capital of Tien Giang Province. Situated on the Mekong River, 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, the city is surrounded by orchards and rice fields, which produce grain for the entire country. Visit one or two of the islands that produce traditional handcrafts, coconut candy and bee farms. Visit the Vinh Trang Pagoda, the oldest one in the delta on your boat trip on the Mekong River. Return to Ho Chi Minh City. Check in hotel & stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: Excursion to Halong Bay and Stay overnight on Board. (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
Early this morning, we’ll drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. We’ll spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since we’re overnight on the water, we’ll be able to explore Ha Long Bay’s most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Boat.

name: Trekking and Kayaking in Cat Ba 4 days 3 nights
summary: This four-day tour trekking in Cat Ba National Park and kayaking in Lan Ha Bay ventures into an area of Cat Ba, unseen by many tourists. Unearth the island’s hidden beauty, far from the usual tourist maps. With your local guide, you’ll safely explore the depths of the jungle and the heights of the limestone mountains before emerging from the canopy for a view of the island. Our unique trekking opportunity is a must-see for anyone who wants to discover Cat Ba’s astounding natural beauty and local culture.

timeline.title: Hanoi - Hai Phong - Cat Ba Island (L/D)
timeline.description: You will depart from your hotel in Hanoi for Hai Phong City then take the express boat to Cat Ba Island, arriving in Cat Ba Island at about midday. You will transfer across the island to the dock and board a small boat to Cai Beo fishing village. You'll enjoy a lunch of fresh local seafood and spend the rest of the day exploring the village or fishing with the local villagers. You will stay overnight in homestay.

timeline.title: Trekking In Cat Ba (B/L/D)
timeline.description: You will enjoy breakfast at the homestay before a beautiful day of trekking. You will trek on Ha Sen Mountain with an experienced and knowledgeable local guide. This is a hard trek which requires a good general level of fitness and some skills in climbing. When you reach the top of the mountain, you will be rewarded with wonderful views of the island and the bay. You will have dinner and spend the night in a homestay.

timeline.title: Kayaking In Lan Ha Bay (B, L, D)
timeline.description: You can spend a whole day cruising on junk and paddling and exploring the bay at your own pace while having a closer look at the amazing karsts. You'll explore some of the many caves that lead to stunning lagoons, paddle to some floating villages to see this unique way of life and stop to chill out at one of the many beaches here. You'll be met by a support boat which you'll board to enjoy lunch before you continue paddling in the afternoon. After a day of exploring, you will travel to quite and safety bays to enjoy for dinner and another relaxing night on boat.

timeline.title: Cat Ba Island - Hanoi (B/L)
timeline.description: You will have breakfast at the homestay before heading out for the morning to explore more of the amazing karst limestone formations and grottos. You will return to the homestay for lunch where you can relax on the beach, throw around the Frisbee and take a swim. In the afternoon you will cruise back to Cat Ba Island, take a ferry to Hai Phong and then drive back to Hanoi.

name: Adventure in Ho Chi Minh City - Mekong Delta 3 days 2 nights
summary: While Ho Chi Minh City certainly dominates Southern Vietnam, there is so much more to see and do besides the exciting metropolis. On this 3 day tour of the region we’ll take you to all the “must see’s” and introduce you to the stunning variety and diversity of the country. From walking the streets of Saigon, to crawling through the claustrophobic tunnels of Cu Chi and relaxing on the peaceful waters of the Mekong Delta, this tour will appeal to travellers of any inclination.

timeline.title: Day 1: CU CHI TUNNELS - HO CHI MINH CITY TOUR ( L )
timeline.description:
After breakfast at hotel, we’ll start our journey in Vietnam by heading over to the famous Cu Chi Tunnels. This amazing network of underground tunnels was used by the Viet Cong and Viet Minh during the Vietnam War, and makes up a veritable underground city, running for a total length of more than 250 kilometres. You’ll have the opportunity to crawl through a section of the tunnels, as well as fire several guns used during the conflict at the firing range. There will also be a guided tour of the ingenious yet macabre traps used to great effect during the war.

Lunch at local restaurant in Cu Chi consisting of rice tapioca and hot tea, the staple of the diet in the tunnels, before heading back to Ho Chi Minh City, arriving at around 13:00.

This afternoon, our guide will show you the most interesting sights that Ho Chi Minh City has to offer. We’ll start with the Reunification Palace, a beautifully preserved structure which served as the residence of the President of the Republic of Vietnam, and on April 30th, 1975, was the site of the official end of the American War. Next is the War Remnants Museum. In this amazing yet heart-wrenching museum you’ll get to see various exhibits relating to the American period of the Vietnam War.

Afterwards its time for more colonial architecture, with a visit to The Notre Dame Cathedral, built in 1880 and resembling its bigger brother in Paris, and the Old Post Office, completed in 1891, which serves as one of the best examples of French colonial architecture. For something more ancient, we pay a visit to the Jade Emperor Pagoda, built in a Chinese style and decorated with bright motifs. 

Our last stop will be at Ben Thanh Market (occasionally replaced with Tan Dinh Market) where you can practice your bargaining skills while shopping for souvenirs. Spend some time discover local life and culture and you’ll find some of the friendliest, liveliest, and most convivial people in the city here.

We’ll return your hotel around 18:00 and the rest of the day is free to spend at your leisure.

timeline.title: Day 2: MEKONG DELTA - MEKONG EYES CRUISE (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
Our activities on the second day depends on the precise date, with tours starting in Cai Be on even dates and in Can Tho on odd dates. The only difference in the options is starting an hour earlier for your drive to Can Tho compared to Cai Be, and the direction that you travel in.

Option 1: Can Tho – Cai Be (odd dates)
You’ll be picked up at the hotel (district 1 and parts of district 3) between 07:00 and 07:30 (only included for those pax using the shuttle service) and drive to the cruise vessel where we’ll board and check in at 11:30. 

We’ll enjoy a panoramic cruise along the peaceful river, enjoying lunch on-board around 13:00 and then set out on a guided land excursion at 16:00 where we walk among orchards and small villages. At 17:30 we return to the boat for refreshments and sunset-gazing on the top deck, before having dinner at 19:00 and overnighting on-board.

Option 2: Cai Be – Can Tho (even dates)
You’ll be picked up at the hotel (district 1 and parts of district 3) between 08:00 and 08:30 (only included for those pax using the shuttle service) and drive to the cruise vessel where we’ll board and check in at 11:30. 

We’ll enjoy a panoramic cruise along the peaceful river, enjoying lunch on-board around 13:00 and then set out on a guided land excursion at 16:00 where we walk among orchards and small villages. At 17:30 we return to the boat for refreshments and sunset-gazing on the top deck, before having dinner at 19:00 and overnighting on-board.

timeline.title: Day 3: MEKONG DELTA - MEKONG EYES CRUISE - HO CHI MINH (B/L/)
timeline.description:
Like on the previous day, tours start in Cai Be on even dates and in Can Tho on odd dates.

Option 1: Can Tho – Cai Be (odd dates)
Rise early (06:30) to enjoy the sunrise and early morning views from the cruise, with morning tea served as you float on the mighty river. At 8am you’ll check out of your cabin and go on an excursion in a small sampan boat, exploring the small canals of Tan Phong Islet and visiting a coconut candy producing family.

At 10am we get on our bicycles (or walk for those who don’t want a bicycle) and ride on back roads in a small village situated amongst the Mekong Canals, before transfer back to Saigon at 11am. On the way back to the city we’ll stop for lunch at a rest stop around noon, and we’ll you off at your hotel in the city around 15:30. As this is the end of our journey it’s time to say your farewells and continue with your onward travel plans.

08.00: Check-out of cabin. Excursion on rowing sampan, exploring small canals of Tan Phong islet, coconut candy producing family.
10.00: Bicycle ride on back roads or walk in a small village along the Mekong Canals 
11.00: Departure of shuttle to Saigon / end of tour

~ 15.30: Arrival in Saigon

Option 2: Cai Be – Can Tho (even dates)
Rise early (06:30) to enjoy the sunrise and early morning views from the cruise, with morning tea served as you float on the mighty river. At 8am you’ll check out of your cabin and go on an excursion in a small sampan boat, visiting the local floating market of Cai Rang and a workshop for noodle production run by a local family.

At 11:30 we transfer back to Saigon, stopping n the way back for lunch in Vinh Long City (only included for those pax using the shuttle service) around 12:30, and we’ll you off at your hotel in the city around 16:30. As this is the end of our journey it’s time to say your farewells and continue with your onward travel plans.

name: Adventure to Cat Ba and Lan Ha Bay 3 days 2 nights
summary: This 3- day adventure will take you through the karst-studded waters of Lan Ha Bay to the stunning Cat Ba Island. As well as taking in some of the most incredible areas in the north of Vietnam, this action-packed trip is full of unforgettable experiences including cruising on a traditional wooden sailboat, hiking through a beautiful national park, staying with local families, discovering cave systems and kayaking. This tour takes you away from the crowded tourist areas so you get to truly enjoy the beauty of this stunning bay.

timeline.title: Hanoi - Cat Ba National Park (L/D)
timeline.description:
You will be collected from your hotel in Hanoi's old quarter at 08:00 to begin the drive to Dinh Vu Harbour. You will then take a 45-minute high-speed boat to Cat Ba Island. After that, you will go to Cat Ba town for lunch.

In the afternoon, you will trek to Viet Hai Village through Cat Ba National Park which is a haven for both bird watching and sightseeing amidst the pristine forest and at Frog Lake. Along the way, you will have the chance to see native cats, squirrels, spotted deer, snakes, thousands of butterflies, and if you’re lucky, one of the rare Cat Ba Langurs.

Rounding out the day, you’ll enjoy dinner and an overnight stay in a bungalow in the local village of Viet Hai.

timeline.title: Lan Ha Bay (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Breakfast will be served at 07:30 followed by a walk to the top of Marine Hill which offers panoramic views of both Ha Long Bay and Lan Ha Bay. On returning to Viet Hai Village, you can try a fish massage or take some time to relax before cycling to Viet Hai Harbour. From here you will board the boat to explore the beauty of Lan Ha Bay. Lunch will be served on-board followed by kayaking excursion around Hang Luon Cave, and if it is hot, the boat will take you to some beautiful wild beaches where you can spend some time swimming and snorkelling before having dinner on-board and spending the night on the boat.

timeline.title: LAN HA BAY - CAT BA - HANOI (B/L)
timeline.description: After enjoying breakfast on the boat with the sun rising in the background you will continue the cruise around Lan Ha Bay, weaving among the myriad of limestone peaks. On this last day you will also get to visit a fish and shellfish farm and the colourful floating village of Cai Beo. Lunch will again be served on-board (or on land if we have new passengers waiting to embark). You will disembark at around 11:30, return to Hanoi, ending your tour of Lan Ha Bay and Cat Ba Island.
